instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> garbled image after 30-60mins (photo)
threads.message:
Hi guys,

(as a sidenote to the admins, I created this thread again yesterday but although I could see it cause I saved the link or search for it, I could not find it in the timeline)

Here is a copy-paste:

"As per title this one crashes producing the attached image after maybe an hour of operation.

No apparent faults.

Any experience with this?

(also why search produces no results by motherboard code or motherboard code+fault?)

br,
George"

and the photo:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> garbled image after 30-60mins (photo)
threads.message: Bad RAM or 1 bad RAM slot, try 1 at a time. If that does not help it is a bad CPU or PCB trace issue and not fixable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> garbled image after 30-60mins (photo)
threads.message:
the "not fixable" is my thing lately... 

I ll try the RAM slots one by one.

cheers duke.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> garbled image after 30-60mins (photo)
threads.message: tried the ram slots and used known good ram too, to no avail. just fyi.
